definition: surname Chen/Chen (c. 1045 - 479 BC), a Zhou dynasty state/Chen (557-589), one of the Southern Dynasties 南朝[Nan2 Chao2]
to lay out/to exhibit/to display/to narrate/to state/to explain/to tell/old/stale

sentences.english: Another trite one. But it works.
sentences.chinese: 另一個陳腐的方法，卻很有效。

sentences.english: The excellence or triteness of your writing was not the matter under consideration.
sentences.chinese: 在卓越或你的寫作陳腐沒有審議的事項。

sentences.english: Because what we really need to chuck is this old-school throw-away mindset.
sentences.chinese: 我們真正要拋棄的是這種隨手即丟的陳腐心態。

sentences.english: “No, I agree, that’s stale, ” Paul said.
sentences.chinese: “對，我同意，那樣過於陳腐了，”保羅說。

sentences.english: She is tired of her husband's stock jokes.
sentences.chinese: 她聽厭了她丈夫那些陳腐的笑話。

sentences.english: It was an obsolete thing, and few cared to study it .
sentences.chinese: 它本是一件老朽陳腐的東西，很少有人願意去研究它。

sentences.english: As policy, these notions are poisonous.
sentences.chinese: 作爲政策，這些陳腐觀念將極具毒害性。

sentences.english: Therefore, the phenomenon of Fang, Hui's case is an inevitable result of Nan Song stale culture.
sentences.chinese: 方回降元是陳腐的南宋文化的必然結果。

sentences.english: Everything old and wrong is new again.
sentences.chinese: 一切陳腐和謬誤的事情現在都是新鮮事兒了。

sentences.english: The  commonsense  commonwealth government no longer uses the  uncommon  commonplace.
sentences.chinese: 有常識的聯邦政府不再使用不尋常的陳腐之言。

sentences.english: But, as usual, the stale political arguments have begun all over again.
sentences.chinese: 但是，一如既往，陳腐的政治爭論再次上演。

sentences.english: For me, it still reeks of 1995 Western design.
sentences.chinese: 對我來着，這仍然是陳腐的1995年西方設計。

sentences.english: His essays can be Oxbridge musty.
sentences.chinese: 他的隨筆或許帶有陳腐的學究氣。

sentences.english: Almost invariably, the cause of failure can be traced to obsolete notions of command and control.
sentences.chinese: 究其原因，總會歸結到命令和控制的陳腐觀念上來。

sentences.english: However, the Spring Festival Gala of this year was creative, bringing forth some new ideas.
sentences.chinese: 今年的春晚倒是一掃陳腐之氣，搞搞新意思。

sentences.english: Archaic, British-era rules on buying land need to be changed.
sentences.chinese: 英國殖民時代那些陳腐的購地規程需要進行改革。

definition: slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
to make a significant advance in one's career (idiom)/to get one's big break
competitive/ambitious and aggressive/to desire to beat others
variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
